required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunogenicity, Safety of GSKs Tdap Vaccine Boostrix When Coadministered With GSKs Influenza Vaccine Fluarix in Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Evaluate Immunogenicity and Safety of Boostrix When Co-administered With Fluarix in Subjects 19 Years of Age and Older

brief_summary.textblock: The current study will provide information for the use of Boostrix concomitantly with influenza vaccine in adults aged 19-64 years. This study will also provide safety and immunogenicity data in a cohort of adults aged greater than or equal to 65 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Diphteria (D) and Tetanus (T) Toxoid Antigens
primary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a vaccinated subject with anti-D and anti-T antibody concentrations equal to or above (≥) 0.1 International Units per milliliter (IU/mL), respectively.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-T Antibody Concentrations ≥ the Assay Cut-off Value
primary_outcome.description: The assay cut-off value was ≥ 1.0 IU/mL, as assessed by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).

primary_outcome.measure: Antibody Concentrations Against Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Filamentous Hemagglutinin (FHA) and Pertactin (PRN) Antigens
primary_outcome.description: Anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN antibody concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in ELISA units per milliliter (EL.U/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serum Haemagglutinin Inhibition (HI) Titers Against 3 Strains of Influenza
primary_outcome.description: The antibody titer cut-off value for the 3 influenza strains assessed (H1N1, H3N2 and B) was ≥ 1:40.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroconverted Subjects Against Influenza Antigens H1N1, H3N2, and B
primary_outcome.description: Seroconversion for HI antibodies is defined as: For initially seronegative subjects: post-vaccination antibody titer ≥ 1:40 at Month 1 post-Boostrix® vaccination; For initially seropositive subjects: antibody titer at Month 1≥ 4 fold the pre-vaccination antibody titer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects With Anti-D Antibody Concentrations Above the Cut-off Value
secondary_outcome.description: A seropositive subject was a subject whose antibody concentration was greater than or equal (≥) to the cut-off value of 1.0 IU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Concentrations for Diphteria Toxoid (D) and Tetanus Toxoid (T)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Day 0 and Month 1 post-Boostrix® vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-D and anti-T antibody concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in International Units per milliliter (IU/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Concentrations for Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Filamentous Hemagglutinin (FHA) and Pertactin (PRN)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Day 0 and Month 1 post-Boostrix® vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN antibody concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in ELISA units per milliliter (EL.U/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Booster Response Against Diphteria Toxoid (D) and Tetanus Toxoid (T) Antigens
secondary_outcome.description: Booster responses for anti-D and anti-T antibodies are defined as: For initially seronegative subjects [pre-vaccination concentration below (<) cut-off 0.1 IU/mL]: antibody concentrations at least four times the assay cut-off (post-vaccination concentration ≥ 0.4 IU/mL), one month after vaccination with Boostrix®; For initially seropositive subjects (pre-vaccination concentration ≥ 0.1 IU/mL): an increase in antibody concentrations of at least four times the pre-vaccination concentration, one month after vaccination with Boostrix®.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Booster Response Against Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Filamentous Hemagglutinin (FHA) and Pertactin (PRN) Antigens
secondary_outcome.description: Booster responses for anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN are defined as: For initially seronegative subjects (pre-vaccination concentration < cut-off of 5 EL.U/mL): antibody concentrations at least four times the cut-off (post-vaccination concentration ≥ 20 EL.U/mL), one month after vaccination with Boostrix®; For initially seropositive subjects with pre-vaccination concentration ≥ 5 EL.U/mL and < 20 EL.U/mL: an increase in antibody concentrations of at least four times the pre-vaccination concentration one month after vaccination with Boostrix®; For initially seropositive subjects with pre-vaccination concentration ≥ 20 EL.U/mL: an increase in antibody concentrations of at least two times the pre-vaccination concentration one month after vaccination with Boostrix®.

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-H1N1, Anti-H3N2 and Anti-B Antibody Titers
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-H1N1, anti-H3N2 and anti-B antibody titers are presented as geometric mean titers (GMTs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 15-day (Day 0-14) period following each dose and across doses, up to 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 50 millimeters (mm) of injection site. Subjects from Boostrix+Fluarix Groups (19-64 YOA and ≥ 65 YOA) received only one vaccination dose (Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine), at Day 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 15-day (Day 0-14) period following each dose and across doses, up to 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, fever [defined as oral temperature equal to or above (≥) 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)], gastrointestinal (nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea and/or abdominal pain), headache, joint pain, muscle aches and shivering. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to the study vaccination. Grade 3 symptom = symptom that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 fever = fever > 39.0 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination. Subjects from Boostrix+Fluarix Groups (19-64 YOA and ≥ 65 YOA) received only one vaccination dose (Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine), at Day 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 31-day period (Day 0-30) following each vaccination, up to 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the whole study period (from Day 0 to Month 2)
secondary_outcome.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life-threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.

arm_group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years of age inclusive and 65 years or older, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years of age inclusive and 65 years or older, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

intervention.description: GSK Biologicals' inactivated influenza split virus vaccine.
GSK Biologicals' tetanus toxoid, reduced diphtheria toxoid and acellular pertussis vaccine adsorbed, containing 0.3 mg aluminum.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male or female adults aged between 19 to 64 years, inclusive for the primary cohort), or aged 65 years or older (for the exploratory cohort), at the time of vaccination.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Administration of an influenza vaccine within six months prior to study entry
- Administration of a diphtheria-tetanus (Td) booster within the previous 5 years.
- Administration of a Tdap vaccine at any time prior to study entry.
- Administration of any investigational or non-registered drug or vaccine other than the study vaccines within 30 days preceding vaccination, or planned use during the entire study period.
- History of diphtheria and/or tetanus and/or pertussis disease.
- History of serious allergic reaction (e.g. anaphylaxis) following any other tetanus toxoid, diphtheria toxoid or pertussis-containing vaccine or influenza vaccine or any component of the study vaccines.

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

reference.citation: Weston WM, Chandrashekar V, Friedland LR, Howe B. Safety and immunogenicity of a tetanus toxoid, reduced diphtheria toxoid, and acellular pertussis vaccine when co-administered with influenza vaccine in adults. Hum Vaccin. 2009 Dec;5(12):858-66. Epub 2009 Dec 31.

Weston WM, Friedland LR, Wu X, Howe B. Vaccination of adults 65 years of age and older with tetanus toxoid, reduced diphtheria toxoid and acellular pertussis vaccine (Boostrix(®)): results of two randomized trials. Vaccine. 2012 Feb 21;30(9):1721-8. doi: 10.1016/j.vaccine.2011.12.055. Epub 2011 Dec 31.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Out of the 1726 subjects originally enrolled in this study, 8 subjects (7 subjects from the 19-64 years of age cohort and 1 subject from the 65 years of age cohort) did not receive the study vaccine and hence were not included in the Total Vaccinated Cohort.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years of age inclusive and 65 years or older, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years of age inclusive and 65 years or older, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive and 65 years or older, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive and 65 years or older, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Diphteria (D) and Tetanus (T) Toxoid Antigens
outcome.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a vaccinated subject with anti-D and anti-T antibody concentrations equal to or above (≥) 0.1 International Units per milliliter (IU/mL), respectively.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, between 19 to 64 years of age (YOA) inclusive, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, between 19 to 64 years of age (YOA) inclusive, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix ≥ 65 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix ≥ 65 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

measure.title: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Diphteria (D) and Tetanus (T) Toxoid Antigens
measure.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a vaccinated subject with anti-D and anti-T antibody concentrations equal to or above (≥) 0.1 International Units per milliliter (IU/mL), respectively.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference in seroprotection rates against diphteria toxoid: To demonstrate that the immunogenicity of Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group) at Day 0, was non-inferior to that of Boostrix® vaccine administered alone at Month 1 (Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of seroprotection rates for anti-D antibody, one month post-Boostrix® vaccination.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was defined as the lower limit of the 95% confidence interval (CI) for the difference between the two groups (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group minus Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of percentages of subjects with anti-D antibody concentrations ≥ 0.1 IU/mL, being ≥ - 10%.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference in seroprotection rates against tetanus toxoid: To demonstrate that the immunogenicity of Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group) at Day 0, was non-inferior to that of Boostrix® vaccine administered alone at Month 1 (Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of seroprotection rates for anti-T antibody, one month post-Boostrix® vaccination.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was defined as the lower limit of the 95% CI for the difference between the two groups (Boostrix+ Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group minus Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of percentage of subjects with anti-T antibody concentrations ≥ 0.1 IU/mL, being ≥ - 10%.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Anti-T Antibody Concentrations ≥ the Assay Cut-off Value
outcome.description: The assay cut-off value was ≥ 1.0 IU/mL, as assessed by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Anti-T Antibody Concentrations ≥ the Assay Cut-off Value
measure.description: The assay cut-off value was ≥ 1.0 IU/mL, as assessed by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference in seropositivity rates against tetanus toxoid: To demonstrate that the immunogenicity of Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group) at Day 0, was non-inferior to that of Boostrix® vaccine administered alone at Month 1 (Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of seropositivity rates for anti-T antibody, one month post-Boostrix® vaccination.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was defined as the lower limit of the 95% CI for the difference between the two groups (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group minus Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of percentage of subjects with anti-T antibody concentrations ≥ 1.0 IU/mL, being ≥ - 10%.

outcome.title: Antibody Concentrations Against Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Filamentous Hemagglutinin (FHA) and Pertactin (PRN) Antigens
outcome.description: Anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN antibody concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in ELISA units per milliliter (EL.U/mL).
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix ≥ 65 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix ≥ 65 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

measure.title: Antibody Concentrations Against Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Filamentous Hemagglutinin (FHA) and Pertactin (PRN) Antigens
measure.description: Anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN antibody concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in ELISA units per milliliter (EL.U/mL).
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference in adjusted GMC ratios for anti-PT antibody: To demonstrate that the immunogenicity of Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group) at Day 0, was non-inferior to that of Boostrix® vaccine administered alone at Month 1 (Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) for anti-PT antibody, one month post-Boostrix® vaccination.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was defined as the lower limit of the 95% CI for GMC ratios of antibodies against the pertussis toxoid (PT) antigens between the two groups (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group minus Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group) being ≥ 0.67.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference in adjusted GMC ratio for anti-FHA antibody: To demonstrate that the immunogenicity of Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group) at Day 0, was non-inferior to that of Boostrix® vaccine administered alone at Month 1 (Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) for anti-FHA antibody, one month post-Boostrix® vaccination.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was defined as the lower limit of the 95% CI for GMC ratios of antibodies against the filamentous hemagglutinin (FHA) antigens between the two groups (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group minus Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group) being ≥ 0.67.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference in adjusted GMC ratio for anti-PRN antibody: To demonstrate that the immunogenicity of Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group) at Day 0, was non-inferior to that of Boostrix® vaccine administered alone at Month 1 (Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) for anti-PRN antibody, one month post-Boostrix® vaccination.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was defined as the lower limit of the 95% CI for GMC ratios of antibodies against the pertactin (PRN) antigens between the two groups (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group minus Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group) being ≥ 0.67.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Serum Haemagglutinin Inhibition (HI) Titers Against 3 Strains of Influenza
outcome.description: The antibody titer cut-off value for the 3 influenza strains assessed (H1N1, H3N2 and B) was ≥ 1:40.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Serum Haemagglutinin Inhibition (HI) Titers Against 3 Strains of Influenza
measure.description: The antibody titer cut-off value for the 3 influenza strains assessed (H1N1, H3N2 and B) was ≥ 1:40.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference in percentage of subjects with anti-H1N1 antibody titers ≥ 1:40: To demonstrate that the immunogenicity of Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group) at Day 0, was non-inferior to that of Fluarix® vaccine administered alone at Day 0 (Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of percentage of subjects with anti-H1N1 antibody titers ≥ 1:40, one month post-Fluarix® vaccination.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was defined as the lower limit of the 95% CI for the difference between the two groups (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group minus Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of percentage of subjects with anti-H1N1 antibody titers ≥ 1:40 being ≥ -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference in percentage of subjects with anti-H3N2 antibody titers ≥ 1:40: To demonstrate that the immunogenicity of Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group) at Day 0, was non-inferior to that of Fluarix® vaccine administered alone at Day 0 (Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of percentage of subjects with anti-H3N2 antibody titers ≥ 1:40, one month post-Fluarix® vaccination.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was defined as the lower limit of the 95% CI for the difference between the two groups (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group minus Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of percentage of subjects with anti-H3N2 antibody titers ≥ 1:40 being ≥ -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference in percentage of subjects with anti-B antibody titers ≥ 1:40: To demonstrate that the immunogenicity of Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group) at Day 0, was non-inferior to that of Fluarix® vaccine administered alone at Day 0 (Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of percentage of subjects with anti-B antibody titers ≥ 1:40, one month post-Fluarix® vaccination.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was defined as the lower limit of the 95% CI for the difference between the two groups (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group minus Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of percentage of subjects with anti-B antibody titers ≥ 1:40 being ≥ -10%.

outcome.title: Number of Seroconverted Subjects Against Influenza Antigens H1N1, H3N2, and B
outcome.description: Seroconversion for HI antibodies is defined as: For initially seronegative subjects: post-vaccination antibody titer ≥ 1:40 at Month 1 post-Boostrix® vaccination; For initially seropositive subjects: antibody titer at Month 1≥ 4 fold the pre-vaccination antibody titer.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

measure.title: Number of Seroconverted Subjects Against Influenza Antigens H1N1, H3N2, and B
measure.description: Seroconversion for HI antibodies is defined as: For initially seronegative subjects: post-vaccination antibody titer ≥ 1:40 at Month 1 post-Boostrix® vaccination; For initially seropositive subjects: antibody titer at Month 1≥ 4 fold the pre-vaccination antibody titer.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference in seroconversion rates for anti-H1N1 antibody: To demonstrate that the immunogenicity of Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group) at Day 0, was non-inferior to that of Fluarix® vaccine administered alone at Day 0 (Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of seroconversion rates for anti-H1N1 antibody, one month post-Fluarix® vaccination.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was defined as the lower limit of the 95% CI for the difference between the two groups (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group minus Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of percentage of subjects with ≥ 4-fold increase in anti-H1N1 antibody titers (seroconversion) being ≥ -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference in seroconversion rates for anti-H3N2 antibody: To demonstrate that the immunogenicity of Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group) at Day 0, was non-inferior to that of Fluarix® vaccine administered alone at Day 0 (Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of seroconversion rates for anti-H3N2 antibody, one month post-Fluarix® vaccination.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was defined as the lower limit of the 95% CI for the difference between the two groups (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group minus Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of percentage of subjects with ≥ 4-fold increase in anti-H3N2 antibody titers (seroconversion) being ≥ -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: Difference in seroconversion rates for anti-B antibody: To demonstrate that the immunogenicity of Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group) at Day 0, was non-inferior to that of Fluarix® vaccine administered alone at Day 0 (Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of seroconversion rates for anti-B antibody, one month post-Fluarix® vaccination.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was defined as the lower limit of the 95% CI for the difference between the two groups (Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group minus Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group), in terms of percentage of subjects with ≥ 4-fold increase anti-B antibody titers (seroconversion) being ≥ -10%.

outcome.title: Number of Seropositive Subjects With Anti-D Antibody Concentrations Above the Cut-off Value
outcome.description: A seropositive subject was a subject whose antibody concentration was greater than or equal (≥) to the cut-off value of 1.0 IU/mL.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix ≥ 65 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix ≥ 65 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

outcome.description: Anti-D and anti-T antibody concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in International Units per milliliter (IU/mL).
outcome.time_frame: At Day 0 and Month 1 post-Boostrix® vaccination
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

outcome.description: Anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN antibody concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in ELISA units per milliliter (EL.U/mL).
outcome.time_frame: At Day 0 and Month 1 post-Boostrix® vaccination
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group

measure.title: Antibody Concentrations for Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Filamentous Hemagglutinin (FHA) and Pertactin (PRN)
measure.description: Anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN antibody concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in ELISA units per milliliter (EL.U/mL).
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Booster Response Against Diphteria Toxoid (D) and Tetanus Toxoid (T) Antigens
outcome.description: Booster responses for anti-D and anti-T antibodies are defined as: For initially seronegative subjects [pre-vaccination concentration below (<) cut-off 0.1 IU/mL]: antibody concentrations at least four times the assay cut-off (post-vaccination concentration ≥ 0.4 IU/mL), one month after vaccination with Boostrix®; For initially seropositive subjects (pre-vaccination concentration ≥ 0.1 IU/mL): an increase in antibody concentrations of at least four times the pre-vaccination concentration, one month after vaccination with Boostrix®.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix ≥ 65 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix ≥ 65 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Booster Response Against Diphteria Toxoid (D) and Tetanus Toxoid (T) Antigens
measure.description: Booster responses for anti-D and anti-T antibodies are defined as: For initially seronegative subjects [pre-vaccination concentration below (<) cut-off 0.1 IU/mL]: antibody concentrations at least four times the assay cut-off (post-vaccination concentration ≥ 0.4 IU/mL), one month after vaccination with Boostrix®; For initially seropositive subjects (pre-vaccination concentration ≥ 0.1 IU/mL): an increase in antibody concentrations of at least four times the pre-vaccination concentration, one month after vaccination with Boostrix®.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Booster Response Against Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Filamentous Hemagglutinin (FHA) and Pertactin (PRN) Antigens
outcome.description: Booster responses for anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN are defined as: For initially seronegative subjects (pre-vaccination concentration < cut-off of 5 EL.U/mL): antibody concentrations at least four times the cut-off (post-vaccination concentration ≥ 20 EL.U/mL), one month after vaccination with Boostrix®; For initially seropositive subjects with pre-vaccination concentration ≥ 5 EL.U/mL and < 20 EL.U/mL: an increase in antibody concentrations of at least four times the pre-vaccination concentration one month after vaccination with Boostrix®; For initially seropositive subjects with pre-vaccination concentration ≥ 20 EL.U/mL: an increase in antibody concentrations of at least two times the pre-vaccination concentration one month after vaccination with Boostrix®.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix ≥ 65 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix ≥ 65 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Booster Response Against Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Filamentous Hemagglutinin (FHA) and Pertactin (PRN) Antigens
measure.description: Booster responses for anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN are defined as: For initially seronegative subjects (pre-vaccination concentration < cut-off of 5 EL.U/mL): antibody concentrations at least four times the cut-off (post-vaccination concentration ≥ 20 EL.U/mL), one month after vaccination with Boostrix®; For initially seropositive subjects with pre-vaccination concentration ≥ 5 EL.U/mL and < 20 EL.U/mL: an increase in antibody concentrations of at least four times the pre-vaccination concentration one month after vaccination with Boostrix®; For initially seropositive subjects with pre-vaccination concentration ≥ 20 EL.U/mL: an increase in antibody concentrations of at least two times the pre-vaccination concentration one month after vaccination with Boostrix®.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

outcome.title: Anti-H1N1, Anti-H3N2 and Anti-B Antibody Titers
outcome.description: Anti-H1N1, anti-H3N2 and anti-B antibody titers are presented as geometric mean titers (GMTs).
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group

measure.title: Anti-H1N1, Anti-H3N2 and Anti-B Antibody Titers
measure.description: Anti-H1N1, anti-H3N2 and anti-B antibody titers are presented as geometric mean titers (GMTs).
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures were available.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms
outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 50 millimeters (mm) of injection site. Subjects from Boostrix+Fluarix Groups (19-64 YOA and ≥ 65 YOA) received only one vaccination dose (Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine), at Day 0.
outcome.time_frame: During the 15-day (Day 0-14) period following each dose and across doses, up to 2 months
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented and with the symptom sheet filled in.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix ≥ 65 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix ≥ 65 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms
measure.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 50 millimeters (mm) of injection site. Subjects from Boostrix+Fluarix Groups (19-64 YOA and ≥ 65 YOA) received only one vaccination dose (Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine), at Day 0.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented and with the symptom sheet filled in.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms
outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, fever [defined as oral temperature equal to or above (≥) 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)], gastrointestinal (nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea and/or abdominal pain), headache, joint pain, muscle aches and shivering. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to the study vaccination. Grade 3 symptom = symptom that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 fever = fever > 39.0 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination. Subjects from Boostrix+Fluarix Groups (19-64 YOA and ≥ 65 YOA) received only one vaccination dose (Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine), at Day 0.
outcome.time_frame: During the 15-day (Day 0-14) period following each dose and across doses, up to 2 months
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented and with the symptom sheet filled in.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix ≥ 65 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix ≥ 65 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms
measure.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, fever [defined as oral temperature equal to or above (≥) 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)], gastrointestinal (nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea and/or abdominal pain), headache, joint pain, muscle aches and shivering. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to the study vaccination. Grade 3 symptom = symptom that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 fever = fever > 39.0 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination. Subjects from Boostrix+Fluarix Groups (19-64 YOA and ≥ 65 YOA) received only one vaccination dose (Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine), at Day 0.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented and with the symptom sheet filled in.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: During the 31-day period (Day 0-30) following each vaccination, up to 2 months
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged 65 years or older, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life-threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.
outcome.time_frame: Throughout the whole study period (from Day 0 to Month 2)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix 19-64 YOA Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

reported_events.time_frame: Solicited local and general symptoms: during the 15-day (Day 0-14) period following each vaccination; Unsolicited AEs: during the 31-day period (Day 0-30) following each vaccination; SAEs: throughout the whole study period (from Day 0 to Month 2).

group.title: Boostrix+Fluarix Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive and 65 years or older, who received Boostrix® vaccine co-administered with Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0, injected intramuscularly in the left and right upper deltoid regions, respectively.

group.title: Fluarix Boostrix Group
group.description: Healthy male or female adults, aged between 19 to 64 years inclusive and 65 years or older, who received Fluarix® vaccine at Day 0 and Boostrix® vaccine at Month 1, both injected intramuscularly in the upper left deltoid region.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
